question_text: Which two statements accurately describe dual-link DVI connectors? (Select two)
answer_options: They use additional pins to increase bandwidth
They are required for analog video signals
They use a DB15 layout for legacy support
They are used for audio transmission over coax
correct_answer: They use additional pins to increase bandwidth
explanation: Dual-link DVI connectors add extra data channels, allowing them to handle high-resolution displays above 1080p.
